summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Pasta with Garlic, Scallions, Cauliflower & Breadcrumbs a try. One serving contains 543 calories, 17g of protein, and 16g of fat. steps.step: Boil water in a large pot. Cook pasta according to package instructions.
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and scallions, and cook until fragrant.
Add cauliflower florets and cook until tender.
Add cooked pasta to the skillet and toss with the cauliflower mixture.
Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and grated cheese.
Serve hot and enjoy!

title: Chicken Parmesan
summary: Chicken Parmesan is a delicious and classic Italian-American dish. One serving contains 750 calories, 45g of protein, and 30g of fat. For $2.50 per serving, this recipe covers 35% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. A mixture of chicken breasts, marinara sauce, mozzarella cheese, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. 350 people have tried and liked this recipe. It is brought to you by foodnetwork.com. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 60 minutes. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 90%, which is tremendous. If you like this recipe, take a look at these similar recipes: Chicken Parmesan, Chicken Parmesan, and Chicken Parmesan.

steps.step: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Dip each chicken breast into beaten eggs, then coat with breadcrumbs.
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Brown the chicken breasts on both sides.
Transfer the chicken breasts to a baking dish. Top each breast with marinara sauce and shredded mozzarella cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is bubbly and golden.
Serve hot with your favorite pasta or salad. Enjoy!

title: Vegan Tacos
summary: Vegan Tacos are a healthy and delicious meal option. One serving contains 350 calories, 12g of protein, and 10g of fat. For $2.00 per serving, this recipe covers 20% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. steps.step: Warm the corn tortillas in a dry skillet over medium heat for about 30 seconds on each side until they are soft and pliable.
In a separate skillet, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the drained and rinsed black beans to the skillet with garlic. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until heated through.
To assemble the tacos, place a spoonful of the black bean mixture onto each warm tortilla.
Top with sliced avocado and any other desired toppings, such as salsa, chopped cilantro, or hot sauce.
Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious vegan tacos!

extendedIngredients.name: black beans
extendedIngredients.original: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed

title: Gluten-Free Pancakes

steps.step: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the gluten-free flour, eggs, milk, and maple syrup until well combined.
Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat. Lightly grease the surface with oil or cooking spray.
Pour about 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake. Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown on both sides.
Repeat with the remaining batter, greasing the skillet as needed.
Serve the pancakes warm with your favorite toppings, such as fresh fruit, maple syrup, or dairy-free yogurt.
Enjoy your delicious gluten-free pancakes!

title: Shrimp Scampi
summary: Shrimp Scampi is a quick and easy seafood dish. One serving contains 400 calories, 35g of protein, and 20g of fat. For $3.00 per serving, this recipe covers 25% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. A mixture of shrimp, garlic, lemon, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. 220 people have tried and liked this recipe. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 88%, which is outstanding. steps.step: In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the minced garlic to the skillet and cook for about 1 minute, or until fragrant.
Add the peeled and deveined shrimp to the skillet, cooking until they turn pink, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Pour in the lemon juice, stirring to combine with the shrimp and garlic. Cook for an additional minute.
Remove the skillet from the heat and serve the shrimp scampi immediately.
Garnish with chopped parsley, if desired, and enjoy!

extendedIngredients.original: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined

Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Add the beef and stir-fry until browned.
Add vegetables and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until tender.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.

steps.step: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until translucent.
Add garlic, ginger, and curry paste, cooking for another minute.
Add mixed vegetables and stir to coat with the curry mixture.
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Serve hot over rice or with naan.

steps.step: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Form the ground beef into patties and season with salt and pepper.
Grill the patties for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until cooked to your desired doneness.
Toast the buns on the grill for 1-2 minutes until golden brown.
Assemble the burgers with lettuce, tomato, cheese, and your favorite condiments.
Serve hot and enjoy your classic beef burger!

title: Kuskus
summary: Kuskus is a traditional North African dish made from steamed semolina wheat. It is a staple food in many countries including Morocco, Algeria, and Tunisia.
story: This dish has been passed down through generations in my family, and it always brings back memories of family gatherings.

steps.step: Place the semolina in a large bowl. Add water slowly and rub the semolina between your hands to form small grains.
Steam the grains in a couscous pot for about 20 minutes.
In a separate pot, cook vegetables and chickpeas with spices.
Combine the steamed couscous with the cooked vegetables and chickpeas.
Serve hot with a sprinkle of fresh herbs on top.

title: Pkaila/Bkaïla
summary: Pkaila is a traditional Tunisian dish made from slow-cooked spinach or chard, often mixed with beans or meat, and seasoned with spices.
story: This dish reminds me of the flavors of Tunisian cuisine I grew up with.

steps.step: In a large pot, heat olive oil and add chopped spinach or chard.
Cook the greens until they are dark and reduced, stirring occasionally.
Add beans or meat and cook for another hour, adding water as needed.
Season with salt, pepper, and other spices.
Serve hot with bread or couscous.

title: Pavlova
summary: Pavlova is a meringue-based dessert named after the Russian ballerina Anna Pavlova. It has a crisp crust and soft, light inside, usually topped with fruit and whipped cream.
story: This dessert is a celebration of delicate flavors and textures.

steps.step: Preheat your oven to 150°C (300°F).
In a large bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Gradually add sugar, beating until glossy and stiff.
Fold in cornstarch, vinegar, and vanilla extract.
Spread the meringue on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, forming a circle.
Bake for 1 hour, then turn off the oven and let it cool completely inside.
Top with whipped cream and fresh fruits before serving.
